SEARCH
Package workers

Class ElasticProcessor

java.lang.Object
workers.ElasticProcessor
public class ElasticProcessor extends Object
This class handles all ElasticSearch functionality. It creates and uses a RestClient, pulls creds from the env, and is the 'final destination' of most if not all api calls for searching, indexing, deleting, ect.

  • Method Details

    • createMusicIndex

      public void createMusicIndex() throws IOException
      Creates a fresh "music" index in Elasticsearch with a predefined mapping for fields such as `name`, `file_id`, `intervals_text`, `measure_map`, and `mei_metadata`. These fields correspond DIRECTLY with the Record attribute names.

      This method:

      • Deletes the existing "music" index if it exists.
      • Defines text and keyword properties with appropriate analyzers and term vectors.
      • Constructs a mapping that supports both static and dynamic fields, particularly allowing dynamic mapping of metadata fields.
      • Creates the new index with this mapping.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is a failure in communicating with the Elasticsearch cluster.

    • deleteExistingIndex

      private void deleteExistingIndex(String indexName) throws IOException
      Deletes the specified index if it exists. Suppresses exception if index is not found.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • createFullTextProperty

      private co.elastic.clients.elasticsearch._types.mapping.Property createFullTextProperty()
      Creates a full-text searchable property with whitespace analyzer and term vectors enabled.

    • createKeywordProperty

      private co.elastic.clients.elasticsearch._types.mapping.Property createKeywordProperty()
      Creates a basic keyword property for exact match fields like name and file_id.

    • createDynamicObjectProperty

      private co.elastic.clients.elasticsearch._types.mapping.Property createDynamicObjectProperty()

    • indexRecord

      public co.elastic.clients.elasticsearch.core.IndexResponse indexRecord(Record record) throws IOException
      Indexes a single Record into the "music" index in Elasticsearch.

      The document is indexed using the record's name as the document ID. If the document already exists, it will be updated. If it does not, it will be created.

      Parameters:
      record - The Record to index.
      Returns:
      The IndexResponse from Elasticsearch.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the indexing operation fails due to a network or IO issue.

    • removeRecord

      public co.elastic.clients.elasticsearch.core.DeleteResponse removeRecord(String name) throws IOException
      Removes a document from the "music" index based on its ID.

      This is typically used to delete a previously indexed Record using its name as the identifier.

      Parameters:
      name - The ID of the document to delete (corresponds to the record's name).
      Returns:
      The DeleteResponse returned by Elasticsearch.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the delete operation fails due to a network or IO issue.

    • advancedPhraseQuery

      public co.elastic.clients.elasticsearch.core.SearchResponse<Record> advancedPhraseQuery(String phrase, Map<String,List<String>> andMap, Map<String,List<String>> orMap, Map<String,List<String>> notMap, int slop, String highlighter, double minScore, int maxResponses) throws IOException
      Executes an advanced phrase-based search query against the "music" index.

      This method constructs a compound query using the provided phrase (on the intervals_text field) combined with boolean filter conditions derived from the andMap, orMap, and notMap, which target subfields within the mei_metadata object.

      The search results may optionally include highlighting and are filtered by a minimum score and limited in size.

      Parameters:
      phrase - A phrase to match against the intervals_text field. If null or blank, matches all.
      andMap - A map of metadata fields to terms where all must be matched (AND).
      orMap - A map of metadata fields to terms where any may match (OR).
      notMap - A map of metadata fields to terms that must not match (NOT).
      slop - The slop parameter for the match phrase query.
      highlighter - Optional highlighter type to apply to the intervals_text field.
      minScore - Minimum score threshold for included results.
      maxResponses - Maximum number of results to return. If -1, the server default is used.
      Returns:
      A SearchResponse containing matching Record documents.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the search operation fails due to IO or network issues.

    • buildFilterQuery

      private co.elastic.clients.elasticsearch._types.query_dsl.Query buildFilterQuery(String metadataField, Map<String,List<String>> fieldMap, ElasticProcessor.BoolClauseType clauseType)
      Builds a nested boolean filter query based on the provided field-value map and clause type.
      Parameters:
      metadataField - The base metadata object field name (e.g., "mei_metadata").
      fieldMap - A map of subfield names to a list of values.
      clauseType - The type of boolean clause to apply (MUST, SHOULD, MUST_NOT).
      Returns:
      A Query representing the combined filter logic.

    • getAndQueryForValue

      public co.elastic.clients.elasticsearch._types.query_dsl.BoolQuery getAndQueryForValue(String metadataField, String key, String value)
      Constructs a boolean query that requires all terms or phrases in the value string to match.
      Parameters:
      metadataField - The base metadata field name.
      key - The subfield within the metadata object.
      value - A string containing terms and/or quoted phrases to match.
      Returns:
      A BoolQuery requiring all parsed components to match.

    • splitPhrasesAndTerms

      public List<String> splitPhrasesAndTerms(String value)
      Splits an input string into individual terms and quoted phrases.
      Parameters:
      value - The raw input string.
      Returns:
      A list of terms or quoted phrases.

    • buildTermOrPhraseQuery

      public co.elastic.clients.elasticsearch._types.query_dsl.Query buildTermOrPhraseQuery(String metadataField, String key, String value)
      Constructs either a match phrase or term query based on the presence of spaces in the value.
      Parameters:
      metadataField - The base metadata field name.
      key - The subfield to search within the metadata field.
      value - The term or phrase to search for.
      Returns:
      A Query object suitable for Elasticsearch.

    • getSearchResponse

      public String getSearchResponse(co.elastic.clients.elasticsearch.core.SearchResponse<Record> response)
      Formats a SearchResponse containing Record objects into a readable string summary.

      This method reports the total number of results and includes information for each hit such as: the source record, score, highlight snippets, index, and document ID.

      Parameters:
      response - the search response to format
      Returns:
      a formatted string summarizing the search results
